instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_P: What is CHGR_CSI_P? CHGR_CSI_P is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_P and CHGR_CSI_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.BC_ACOK: What is BC_ACOK? This is a typo of SMC_BC_ACOK. When you see BC_ACOK, assume they meant to type SMC_BC_ACOK.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message:
Hi guys!

I have a motherboard which has apparently been to another repair shop but they couldn't do anything with it.

No charging light is the issue. Works fine on battery though.

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_N</SIGNAL> are only showing 1.2v.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_ICOMP</SIGNAL> 2.8v (is this right?)
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> 1.39v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH_FET</SIGNAL> about 1.3v but drains slowly.

Any help greatly appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message:
Tried known good magsafe board?
PP3V42 present on AC only? ACOK present? Check voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message:
Magsafe board(s) confirmed working.

<CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> pin 1 16.3v, pin 2 0v

How do I check if PP3V42 present on AC only? I checked <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> pin 1 and it gave 3.4v with just charger, just battery and both battery and charger plugged in - is that what you mean?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message: No - sorry, I missed that in your original question.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message: ACIN voltage on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> line? <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> pull up resistor ok?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message: Check resistance of <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>. If it is ok then replace <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message: I got this board working. I replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and also had to make jumpers between <CAPACITOR>C4903</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4908</CAPACITOR> but also a really long jumper between <CAPACITOR>C4902</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR>. Is there a physically shorter jumper I can make than that?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
threads.message: No idea about the jumpers, check board view for closest 3V42 points.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no charger light
